author: pburba
msg: Be consistent about what pool is passed to the svn_wc_walk_entries3's
svn_wc_entry_callbacks2_t.found_entry callback.
* subversion/include/svn_wc.h
(svn_wc_walk_entries3): Document what pool is passed to the callbacks.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/entries.c
(walker_helper): Always pass the subpool to the found_entry callbacks,
previously the pool arg to svn_wc_walk_entries3 was passed for the first
entry and a subpool was passed for all others.

author: pburba
msg: Remove some needless and potentially confusing pool-fu related to the
children_with_mergeinfo array.
In many places in merge.c we allocate new elements to the
CHILDREN_WITH_MERGEINFO array from CHILDREN_WITH_MERGEINFO->POOL, rather
than the pool passed to the function.  There was one case I could see that
required this: When calling svn_wc_walk_entries3 to create the initial
children_with_mergeinfo array, the first callback sends the pool passed
to svn_wc_walk_entries3, but subesequent callbacks send a subpool.
Regardless of svn_wc_walk_entries3's quirks, the better approach is to
stash a pool in the callback baton.  *Maybe* there once were other reasons
for this, but there is no longer one today.  In every case the pool passed
to to the function and CHILDREN_WITH_MERGEINFO->POOL, is the *same* pool
(or the correct pool is readily available).
* subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(populate_remaining_ranges, insert_child_to_merge): Add a pool argument.
(get_mergeinfo_walk_baton): Add a pool member.
(get_mergeinfo_walk_cb): Allocate from pool arg.
(get_mergeinfo_paths): Allocate new children_with_mergeinfo elements
from baton's pool.
(insert_parent_and_sibs_of_sw_absent_del_entry): Update call to
insert_child_to_merge and allocate from pool arg.
(get_mergeinfo_paths): Allocate from pool arg, stash pool in the
callback baton.
(process_children_with_new_mergeinfo): Allocate new
children_with_mergeinfo elements from the pool argument.
(do_directory_merge): Pass the pool argument to
populate_remaining_ranges() rather than the iterpool.

author: stsp
msg: Add a new function to detect the EOL marker of a file.
* subversion/include/svn_subst.h
(svn_subst_detect_file_eol): Declare.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/subst.c
(svn_subst_detect_file_eol): New function to detect the EOL marker
of a file.
* subversion/tests/libsvn_subr/subst-test.c: New file.
(test_detect_file_eol): New unit test for svn_subst_detect_file_eol().
* build.conf
(subst-test): Build new unit test.
(__ALL_TESTS__): Add new test here to make Windows happy.

author: stsp
msg: Add an assertion to guard against invalid use of svn_subst_detect_eol().
* subversion/libsvn_subr/subst.c
(svn_subst_detect_eol): We should consider converting this function to
take a pointer and a buffer size argument, instead of two pointers which
define the buffer's boundaries. For now, just add an assert which if
triggered indicates a bug in the caller.

author: hwright
msg: Adapt the wc_db relocate API for our current db-per-dir paradigm (with nice
breadcrumbs as to how to get back to the "right" way).
* subversion/tests/libsvn_wc/db-test.c
(test_global_relocate): Run the API in "centralized" mode.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc_db.c
(relocate_txn): Ensure parent URLs are proper subdirs in a select statement.
(svn_wc__db_global_relocate): Recurse over the subdirs, if run in
"db-per-dir" mode.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc_db.h
(svn_wc__db_check_node): Update param list and docs.
